Description: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FOR R&D - PAPER-BASED COLORIMETRIC WATER QUALITY SENSORS

TITLE: WISCONSIN WATER USE DATA QUALITY CONTROL PROJECT FY2024LONG TITLE: QUALITY CONTROL IMPLEMENTATION ON EXISTING AND FUTURE SELF-REPORTED MONTHLY WATER WITHDRAWALS IN SUPPORT OF WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WATER USE DATABASE.PROJECT PERIOD 9 1 2023 THROUGH 8 31 2025THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (DNR) IS A CURRENT PROVIDER OF WATER USE INFORMATION TO THE PUBLIC INCLUDING THE U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS). THIS PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT AUTOMATED QUALITY CONTROL CHECKS ON BOTH EXISTING AND FUTURE WATER USE DATA ENTRIES. IN ADDITION TO IMPROVING EXISTING DATA, THE WISCONSIN DNR WILL IMPLEMENT QUALITY CONTROL CHECKS UPON DATA AS IT IS ENTERED INTO THE STATE S DATABASE EVERY YEAR.DURING THIS PROJECT, THE WISCONSIN DNR WILL REQUIRE MODIFICATION OF EXISTING DATABASE TABLES AND SCHEMA. THESE MODIFICATIONS WILL IMPROVE THE ROBUSTNESS OF THE EXISTING DATABASE BY ADDING HISTORICAL WATER USE REPORTS MADE PRIOR TO 2010 TO THE DATABASE, AS WELL AS ASSOCIATING OLDER HIGH-CAPACITY WELLS WITH WELL CONSTRUCTION REPORTS, WHICH WILL IMPROVE THE IDENTIFICATION OF GEOLOGY AND AQUIFERS BEING UTILIZED FOR GROUNDWATER WITHDRAWALS. THIS OBJECTIVE WOULD ASSIST WDNR WITH ASSOCIATING A WITHDRAWAL WITH AN AQUIFER (USGS TIER 1 IRRIGATION  GOLF COURSES, INDUSTRIAL). ADDITIONALLY, THE PROJECT WILL EVALUATE THE FEASIBILITY OF DEVELOPING A STATEWIDE SPATIAL MAP OF WISCONSINS MORE THAN 600 MUNICIPAL WATER SUPPLY SERVICE AREAS. THIS FEASIBILITY ANALYSIS WILL CLARIFY THE BUSINESS NEEDS FOR A STATEWIDE WATER SUPPLY SERVICE AREA GIS LAYER, CREATE A METHODOLOGY FOR DEVELOPING THAT STATEWIDE LAYER, AND INCLUDE A PILOT PROJECT TO IDENTIFY POTENTIALLY COMMON ISSUES WITH INTEGRATING SERVICE AREAS FROM VARIOUS SOURCES. THIS OBJECTIVE WOULD ASSIST WDNR WITH IMPROVING POPULATION SERVED ESTIMATES AND DETERMINING INTERBASIN TRANSFERS (USGS TIER 3 PUBLIC SUPPLY).OVERALL, THE PROJECT IDENTIFIED TASKS RELEVANT TO STATE PRIORITIES WITHIN THE WISCONSIN WATER-USE DATA AND RESEARCH WORKPLAN. THIS PROJECT INCLUDES ELEMENTS THAT CAN BE REPEATABLE BY OTHER STATE WATER-RESOURCE AGENCIES. ADDITIONALLY, THE USAGE OF PYTHON SCRIPTS TO IDENTIFY OUTLIERS IS INNOVATIVE, AND THESE SCRIPTS WILL BE POTENTIALLY BENEFICIAL TO THE USGS AND OTHER STATE AGENCIES. AS PART OF THE PROJECT, WISCONSIN DNR WILL: (1) TO IMPROVE EXISTING DATA QUALITY CONTROL  (2) IMPLEMENT NEW DATA ENTRY QUALITY CONTROL  (3) ADD HISTORICAL WATER WITHDRAWAL RECORDS  AND, (4) CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY ANALYSIS FOR DEVELOPING A STATEWIDE GIS LAYER OF MUNICIPAL WATER SUPPLY SERVICE AREAS.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: WISCONSIN DNR, WATER USERS WITHIN WISCONSIN, AND USERS OF DATA PROVIDED BY THE USGS NATIONAL WATER INFORMATION SYSTEM.

TITLE: ILLINOIS STATE WATER SURVEY 2023 WUDR PROJECTLONG TITLE: ENHANCING IWIP S WATER USE CLASSIFICATION CAPABILITIES TO ALIGN WITH USGS DATA STANDARDS AND BETTER ASSIST UMRBA IN WATER AVAILABILITY ASSESSMENTSPROJECT PERIOD 9 1 2023 THROUGH 8 31 2025THE ILLINOIS STATE WATER SURVEY (ISWS) MAINTAINS THE ILLINOIS WATER INVENTORY PROGRAM (IWIP), THE LARGEST REPOSITORY FOR WATER WELL, INTAKE RECORDS, AND WITHDRAWALS AND USE DATA IN THE STATE OF ILLINOIS. THE ISWS IS ALSO THE ONLY ORGANIZATION IN ILLINOIS THAT TRACKS WATER USE FROM INDUSTRIAL AND COMMERCIAL INTERESTS. THE ISWS CURRENTLY PROVIDES THE UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS) WITH AN UPDATED LIST OF WELLS AND INTAKES IN THE STATE OF ILLINOIS EVERY FIVE YEARS DURING THE COMPILATION OF WATER USE SUMMARY REPORTS. DURING THIS PROJECT, ISWS WILL REVIEW THE STANDARD INDUSTRIAL CLASSIFICATION (SIC) CODES OF WELLS WITHIN THE IWIP DATABASE THAT WERE FLAGGED AS OUTLIERS AND ASSIGN THEM THE APPROPRIATE SIC CODE BASED ON DOCUMENTATION, PAST REPORTS, AND DISCUSSION WITH THE OWNER OPERATOR OF THE WELL (IF NECESSARY). ONCE THE SIC CODE HAS BEEN CONFIRMED AND CORRECTED, THE POINTS WATER USE WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR USE BY ISWS SCIENTISTS IN RESEARCH PROJECTS AND FOR FULFILLING REQUESTS FOR WATER-RELATED INFORMATION FROM CONSTITUENTS. THIS WILL HELP THE SYSTEMATIC PROCESS OF SEPARATING WATER WITHDRAWAL DATA INTO USGS WATER USE CATEGORIES, RESULTING IN MORE COMPREHENSIVE AND USABLE WATER USE CATEGORIES THAT CAN BE ACCESSED BY PLANNERS, RESEARCHERS, MANAGERS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN ILLINOIS AND ACROSS THE NATION. OVERALL, THE PROJECT INCLUDES TASKS RELEVANT TO STATE PRIORITIES WITHIN THE ILLINOIS WATER-USE DATA AND RESEARCH WORKPLAN. THE PROJECT TASKS ALSO ALIGN WITH ISWS AND USGS WATER USE GOALS. AS PART OF THE PROJECT, ALL GENERATED DATA WILL BE AVAILABLE TO THE USGS UPON REQUEST IN MACHINE READABLE FORMAT. POINT WITHDRAWAL DATA WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC WATER SUPPLIES AND AGGREGATED WITHDRAWAL DATA AT A COUNTY OR WATERSHED LEVEL WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR NON-PUBLIC WATER SUPPLIES.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: ILLINOIS STATE WATER SURVEY, WATER USERS WITHIN ILLINOIS, AND USERS OF DATA PROVIDED BY THE USGS NATIONAL WATER INFORMATION SYSTEM.

TITLE: DELAWARE DNREC 2023 WUDR PROJECTLONG TITLE: IMPROVING QUALITY, ACCURACY, AND ACCESSIBILITY OF ALLOCATED WATER WITHDRAWALS RECORDS IN DELAWARE TO SUPPORT THE DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL, DIVISION OF WATER, RESOURCE PROTECTION SECTION.PROJECT PERIOD 9 1 2023 THROUGH 8 31 2025THE DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL (DNREC) IS A CURRENT PROVIDER OF WATER USE INFORMATION TO THE PUBLIC INCLUDING THE U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS). THIS PROJECT WILL QUALITY ASSURE ALL EXISTING DIGITAL RECORDS AND INCORPORATE ALL RECORDS INTO EARTHSOFTS ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY INFORMATION SYSTEM (EQUIS). ADDITIONALLY, THE PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE ACCURACY OF RECORDS BY INCLUDING GEOSPATIAL INFORMATION ON EACH INDIVIDUAL WELL OR INTAKE, LISTING THE WATER SOURCE AND NORTH AMERICAN INDUSTRY CLASSIFICATION CODES (NAICS) CODE FOR INDUSTRIAL SITES.DURING THIS PROJECT, THE DELAWARE DNREC WILL REVIEW AND COMBINE HISTORICAL WELL PERMITS AND ALLOCATION REPORTS STORED IN DISPARATE MICROSOFT STRUCTURED QUERY ANALYSIS (SQL) AND ACCESS DATABASES, MICROSOFT EXCEL SPREADSHEETS, AND PAPER DOCUMENTS. AS PART OF THE PROCESS, THE DATABASE WILL BE REFORMATTED, AND A UNIQUE DELAWARE DNREC IDENTIFICATION NUMBER WILL BE ASSIGNED TO EACH WELL OR INTAKE. ADDITIONALLY, THE HISTORICAL WELL PERMITS AND ALLOCATION REPORTS WILL BE REVIEWED FOR ANOMALIES AND MISSING INFORMATION. SPATIAL COORDINATES OF WELLS AND INTAKES WILL BE LOCATED IF AVAILABLE AND ENTERED IN THE DATABASE. SPATIAL COORDINATES FOR WELLS WILL BE LOCATED EITHER FROM EXISTING RECORDS OR DETERMINED USING REAL-TIME KINEMATIC (RTK) POSITIONING SURVEYS. ADDITIONAL PERTINENT INFORMATION ABOUT THE WELLS OR INTAKES SUCH AS SOURCE AQUIFER, AND THE HYDROLOGIC UNIT CODE 12 WILL BE ADDED.OVERALL, THE PROJECT INCLUDES TASKS RELEVANT TO STATE PRIORITIES WITHIN THE DELAWARE WATER-USE DATA AND RESEARCH WORKPLAN. THIS PROJECT INCLUDES AN EMPHASIS ON SITE SPECIFIC WATER-USE DATA AND THE ADDITION OF THE NAICS CODES TO THE INDUSTRIAL RECORDS. THESE EFFORTS WILL ALSO BEGIN THE TRANSITION FOR THE CATEGORIES OF PUBLIC SUPPLY, INDUSTRIAL AND IRRIGATION INTO THE USGS BASELINE STANDARDS TIER 2 REPORTING BY PROVIDING SITE SPECIFIC WITHDRAWALS BY WELL, LOCATION, SOURCE AND ANNUAL OR MONTHLY REPORTING. AS PART OF THE PROJECT, DELAWARE DNREC WILL DO THE FOLLOWING:1) QUALITY ASSURE EXISTING DATA AND REFORMAT TO A STANDARD TEMPLATE  2) IMPROVE USGS BASELINE STANDARDS TIER LEVEL BY INCLUDING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION IN THE DATABASE  AND, 3) PROVIDE ACCESSIBILITY OF THE DATA IN EQUIS.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: DELAWARE DNREC, WATER USERS WITHIN DELAWARE, AND USERS OF DATA PROVIDED BY THE USGS NATIONAL WATER INFORMATION SYSTEM.

GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES, ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION DIVISION  EPD   DATA QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS TO NON FARM SURFACE WATER AND  GROUNDWATER PROGRAM USAGE DATABASE TO SUPPORT GEORGIA EPD WUDR PROJECTPROJECT PERIOD 9 30 2022 THROUGH 9 29 2024 THE GEORGIA ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION DIVISION  EPD , PART OF THE GEORGIA DEPARTMENT NATURAL RESOURCES, IS A CURRENT PROVIDER OF WATER USE INFORMATION TO THE PUBLIC INCLUDING THE U S  GEOLOGICAL SURVEY  USGS   THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE ADVANCEMENT OF GEORGIA EPD S WATER USE DATA COLLECTION, INCLUDING IMPROVEMENTS TO DEVELOP A FULLY FUNCTIONAL CLOUD BASED DATABASE WITH AN OVERALL IMPROVEMENT IN COMPLIANCE AND PERMIT REQUIREMENT TRACKING DURING THIS PROJECT THE EPD WILL INCORPORATE RELEVANT PERMIT COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS, INCLUDING LOW FLOW PROTECTION AND WATER EFFICIENCY REQUIREMENTS, INTO THE CLOUD BASED DATABASE  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCORPORATE WATER PURCHASES AND SALES BETWEEN DIFFERENT WATER SYSTEMS AS WELL AS INTERBASIN TRANSFER DATA  TO CALCULATE  PER CAPITA  AND  INDUSTRIAL USAGE PER UNIT  WITHIN THE DATABASE, SEPARATE FIELDS WILL BE DEVELOPED SUCH AS THE WATER WITHDRAWN FOR GENERAL WATER USE CATEGORIES  INCLUDING RESIDENTIAL, COMMERCIAL, AND INDUSTRIAL WATER USAGE  AND THE GALLONS OF WATER USED TO PRODUCE A QUANTITY OF PRODUCT FOR PERMITTED INDUSTRIAL FACILITIES  WATER EFFICIENCY DATA COMPILED FROM THE ANNUAL WATER AUDITS WILL ALSO BE INCORPORATED INTO THE DATABASE SO EPD CAN TRACK WHETHER A SYSTEM IS IMPROVING ITS WATER EFFICIENCY OVER TIME OVERALL, THE PROJECT WILL IMPROVE DATA COLLECTION, ANALYSIS, AND TRANSMITTAL OF DATA MANAGED BY THE NON FARM SURFACE WATER AND GROUNDWATER UNITS WITHIN EPD  ACCESS TO THIS DATA WILL ALLOW GEORGIA EPD TO EASILY SHARE IT WITH OTHER AGENCIES, INCLUDING USGS, TO MAKE FUTURE REGULATORY AND POLICY DECISIONS AND ESTABLISH NATIONAL TRENDS  ADDITIONALLY, THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL INCREASE THE  USGS TIER LEVEL  FOR THE PUBLIC SUPPLY, INDUSTRIAL, AND IRRIGATION   GOLF COURSE USE CATEGORIES  THE FUNDING FOR THE TWO YEAR PROJECT IS  125,000 00 AS PART OF THE PROJECT, GEORGIA EPD WILL  1  DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT EVERY SIX MONTHS OF WORK  2  ALLOW THE USGS FULL ACCESS TO ALL DATA PRODUCED DURING THE PROJECT  3  ENSURE THAT THE NEW CLOUD BASED DATABASE GIVES APPROPRIATE ACCESS TO PUBLIC DATA  AND, 4  PRODUCE A FINAL TECHNICAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE  GEORGIA EPD, WATER USERS WITHIN GEORGIA, AND USERS OF DATA PROVIDED BY THE USGS NATIONAL WATER INFORMATION SYSTEM
